Annotation.note:
If the perpendiculars from a point $D$ of the circumcircle $(O)$ of a triangle $ABC$ to the sides $BC$, $CA$, $AB$ meet $(O)$ again in the points $N$, $M$, $L$, the three lines $AN$, $BM$, $CL$ are parallel to the simson of $D$ for $ABC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
